vn.map4d.map.core.gestures

Class AndroidGesturesManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • vn.map4d.map.core.gestures.AndroidGesturesManager

  • @UiThread
public class AndroidGesturesManager
extends java.lang.Object
    Entry point for all of the detectors. Set listener for gestures you'd like to be notified about and pass all of the MotionEvents through onTouchEvent(MotionEvent) to start processing gestures.

      • AndroidGesturesManager

        public AndroidGesturesManager(android.content.Context context)
        Creates a new instance of the AndroidGesturesManager.
        Parameters:
        context - activity's context

      • AndroidGesturesManager

        public AndroidGesturesManager(android.content.Context context,
                              boolean applyDefaultThresholds)
        Creates a new instance of the AndroidGesturesManager.
        Parameters:
        context - activity's context
        applyDefaultThresholds - if true, default gestures thresholds and adjustments will be applied

      • AndroidGesturesManager

        @SafeVarargs
public AndroidGesturesManager(android.content.Context context,
                                            java.util.Set<java.lang.Integer>... exclusiveGestures)
        Creates a new instance of the AndroidGesturesManager.
        Parameters:
        context - Activity's context
        exclusiveGestures - a number of sets of AndroidGesturesManager.GestureTypes that should not be invoked at the same. This means that when a set contains a ProgressiveGesture and this gestures is in progress no other gestures from the set will be invoked.

        At the moment GESTURE_TYPE_SCROLL is not interpreted as a progressive gesture because it is not implemented this way by the GestureDetectorCompat.

      • AndroidGesturesManager

        public AndroidGesturesManager(android.content.Context context,
                              java.util.List<java.util.Set<java.lang.Integer>> exclusiveGestures,
                              boolean applyDefaultThresholds)
        Creates a new instance of the AndroidGesturesManager.
        Parameters:
        context - Activity's context
        exclusiveGestures - a list of sets of AndroidGesturesManager.GestureTypes that should not be invoked at the same. This means that when a set contains a ProgressiveGesture and this gestures is in progress no other gestures from the set will be invoked.

        At the moment GESTURE_TYPE_SCROLL is not interpreted as a progressive gesture because it is not implemented this way by the GestureDetectorCompat.

        applyDefaultThresholds - if true, default gestures thresholds and adjustments will be applied

    • Method Detail

      • onTouchEvent

        public boolean onTouchEvent(android.view.MotionEvent motionEvent)
        Passes motion events to all gesture detectors.
        Parameters:
        motionEvent - event provided by the Android OS.
        Returns:
        true if the touch event is handled by any gesture, false otherwise.

      • setMoveGestureListener

        public void setMoveGestureListener(MoveGestureDetector.OnMoveGestureListener listener)
        Sets a listener for move gestures.

        MoveGestureDetector serves similar purpose to #onScroll(MotionEvent, MotionEvent, float, float), however, it's a ProgressiveGesture that introduces MoveGestureDetector.OnMoveGestureListener.onMoveBegin(MoveGestureDetector), MoveGestureDetector.OnMoveGestureListener.onMoveEnd(MoveGestureDetector, float, float), threshold with MoveGestureDetector.setMoveThreshold(float) and multi finger support thanks to MoveDistancesObject.

        Parameters:
        listener - your gestures listener

      • removeMoveGestureListener

        public void removeMoveGestureListener()
        Removes a listener for move gestures.

      • setMutuallyExclusiveGestures

        @SafeVarargs
public final void setMutuallyExclusiveGestures(java.util.Set<java.lang.Integer>... exclusiveGestures)
        Sets a number of sets containing mutually exclusive gestures.
        Parameters:
        exclusiveGestures - a number of sets of AndroidGesturesManager.GestureTypes that should not be invoked at the same. This means that when a set contains a ProgressiveGesture and this gestures is in progress no other gestures from the set will be invoked.

        At the moment GESTURE_TYPE_SCROLL is not interpreted as a progressive gesture because it is not interpreted this way by the GestureDetectorCompat.

      • setMutuallyExclusiveGestures

        public void setMutuallyExclusiveGestures(java.util.List<java.util.Set<java.lang.Integer>> exclusiveGestures)
        Sets a list of sets containing mutually exclusive gestures.
        Parameters:
        exclusiveGestures - a list of sets of AndroidGesturesManager.GestureTypes that should not be invoked at the same. This means that when a set contains a ProgressiveGesture and this gestures is in progress no other gestures from the set will be invoked.

        At the moment GESTURE_TYPE_SCROLL is not interpreted as a progressive gesture because it is not interpreted this way by the GestureDetectorCompat.

      • getMutuallyExclusiveGestures

        Returns:
        mutually exclusive gestures
